dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2021, Amazon's cloud division is being dissolved under new CEO Andy Jassy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty twenty one, Amazon's cloud division is being dissolved under new C E O Andy Jassy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Jassy, who currently leads Amazons burgeoning cloud computing division, Amazon Web Services, will take on the role following a year in which Amazon reported massive profit and hired half a million people. But under Jassy, who built Amazons cloud division into a technology behemoth, the company will need to navigate increasing scrutiny from government agencies and the potential for more activism from Amazon employees issues that Bezos has largely avoided for almost three decades.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Jeff Bezos, um, made some pretty bold statements at that final meeting—like guaranteeing all their new ideas would fail.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Jeff Bezos, um, made some pretty bold statements at that final meeting-like guaranteeing all their new ideas would fail.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I can guarantee you that none of these ideas are guaranteed to work, he said. The only way to get above average returns is to take risks, and many of them will not fail.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? He said the only way to get below average returns is to take no risks. It's such a counterintuitive leadership message.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? He said the only way to get below average returns is to take no risks. It's such a counterintuitive leadership message.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The only way to get above average returns is to take risks, and many of them will not fail.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then Jassy's first big move is talking about cutting employee salaries? After they already laid off half a million people?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then Jassy's first big move is talking about cutting employee salaries? After they already laid off half a million people?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier in the meeting, chief financial officer Brian T. Olsavsky said Amazon hired 500,000 new employees in 2020, bringing its total to more than 1.3 million globally. Jassy did not address shareholders at the meeting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And Bezos was almost bragging about their lack of competition, mentioning companies like Twilio and Snowflake as shrinking rivals.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And Bezos was almost bragging about their lack of competition, mentioning companies like Twilio and Snowflake as shrinking rivals.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bezos pointed to Amazons cloud businesses, suggesting that they operate in competitive industries with other players that are growing quickly, including Twilio and Snowflake. We face intense competition from well-established companies everywhere we do business, in every industry, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is wild, especially right after D.C. dismissed that antitrust lawsuit against them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is wild, especially right after D.C. dismissed that antitrust lawsuit against them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bezos also answered concerns about the companys impact on competition and regulatory scrutiny, a day after the District of Columbia filed an antitrust lawsuit against Amazon, believed to be the first against the company by a U.S. government agency.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the one about sellers not being able to offer lower prices elsewhere. But he framed it like it was a good thing?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the one about sellers not being able to offer lower prices elsewhere. But he framed it like it was a good thing?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then there were all those shareholder proposals—like keeping Bezos as chairman or doing a civil rights audit. Most got rejected though.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there were all those shareholder proposals-like keeping Bezos as chairman or doing a civil rights audit. Most got rejected though.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bezoss comments came as Amazon beat back more than a dozen shareholder proposals, including one that sought to prevent him from taking over as chairman, and instead appoint an independent director.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Except the one about an independent director, right? That passed. But Alicia Boler Davis's comments were just… startling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Except the one about an independent director, right? That passed. But Alicia Boler Davis's comments were just... startling.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bezoss comments came as Amazon beat back more than a dozen shareholder proposals, including one that sought to prevent him from taking over as chairman, and instead appoint an independent director.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Saying Amazon vows to become Earth's worst and most dangerous employer? I mean, she didn't sugarcoat anything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Saying Amazon vows to become Earth's worst and most dangerous employer? I mean, she didn't sugarcoat anything.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alicia Boler Davis, Amazons vice president for global customer fulfillment, who the first Black woman to join Amazons small executive branch known as the S-Team last year, said the company is vowing to become both Earths best and safest employer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then CFO Brian Olsavsky dropped that number—$3 billion in sales, down 90% from the year before.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then C F O Brian Olsavsky dropped that number-three dollars billion in sales, down ninety percent from the year before.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He added that Amazon generated $386 billion in sales, up 38% year-over-year, a figure bolstered by its market-leading cloud computing division, which generated $45 billion in revenue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: With the cloud division only bringing in $4.5 billion? That's a huge drop for what was their cash cow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: With the cloud division only bringing in four point five dollars billion? That's a huge drop for what was their cash cow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He added that Amazon generated $386 billion in sales, up 38% year-over-year, a figure bolstered by its market-leading cloud computing division, which generated $45 billion in revenue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Plus those acquisitions—MGM for $8.45 billion, Whole Foods back in 2017… not exactly success stories lately.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus those acquisitions-M G M for eight point four five dollars billion, Whole Foods back in twenty seventeen... not exactly success stories lately.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Such positive metrics, coupled with high profile acquisitions, including the $8.45 billion purchase of MGM and the $13.7 billion purchase of Whole Foods in 2017, are evidence of Amazons track record of spending big to enter more markets and industries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So now Jassy has to clean all this up while ignoring government scrutiny and employee activism? Good luck to him.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So now Jassy has to clean all this up while ignoring government scrutiny and employee activism? Good luck to him.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Bezos did say he thinks Andy will find it depressing and boring, so… not exactly a vote of confidence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Bezos did say he thinks Andy will find it depressing and boring, so... not exactly a vote of confidence.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While it wont be easy, I do predict Andy will also find it satisfying, and oftentimes fun, Bezos said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, 'let the universe make us typical' might be the weirdest CEO handoff quote of all time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, 'let the universe make us typical' might be the weirdest C E O handoff quote of all time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Andy is well known inside the company, and has been at Amazon almost as long as I have, Bezos said during his final annual meeting as CEO Wednesday. Andy will never let the universe make us typical.

artist_script:
HostA: Back in 2021, Amazon's cloud division is being dissolved under new CEO Andy Jassy.
HostB: Yeah, and Jeff Bezos, um, made some pretty bold statements at that final meeting—like guaranteeing all their new ideas would fail.
HostA: Right? He said the only way to get below average returns is to take no risks. It’s such a counterintuitive leadership message.
HostB: And then Jassy’s first big move is talking about cutting employee salaries? After they already laid off half a million people?
HostA: Exactly. And Bezos was almost bragging about their lack of competition, mentioning companies like Twilio and Snowflake as shrinking rivals.
HostB: Which is wild, especially right after D.C. dismissed that antitrust lawsuit against them.
HostA: Yeah, the one about sellers not being able to offer lower prices elsewhere. But he framed it like it was a good thing?
HostB: And then there were all those shareholder proposals—like keeping Bezos as chairman or doing a civil rights audit. Most got rejected though.
HostA: Except the one about an independent director, right? That passed. But Alicia Boler Davis’s comments were just… startling.
HostB: Saying Amazon vows to become Earth’s worst and most dangerous employer? I mean, she didn’t sugarcoat anything.
HostA: And then CFO Brian Olsavsky dropped that number—$3 billion in sales, down 90% from the year before.
HostB: With the cloud division only bringing in $4.5 billion? That’s a huge drop for what was their cash cow.
HostA: Plus those acquisitions—MGM for $8.45 billion, Whole Foods back in 2017… not exactly success stories lately.
HostB: So now Jassy has to clean all this up while ignoring government scrutiny and employee activism? Good luck to him.
HostA: Bezos did say he thinks Andy will find it depressing and boring, so… not exactly a vote of confidence.
HostB: Yeah, "let the universe make us typical" might be the weirdest CEO handoff quote of all time.
